column4: I just installed beryl, but my desktop only shows white, nothing else, i can scroll between them, etc, but its all white, no menus, icons, etc.
it isnt. ./configure make install
ah.. thats never fun
i've moved files that were in use.
oh

i've downloaded videos to my desktop, started watching them(mostly tv shows), realized i wanted to keep it, then moved it to a folder in my home folder that i back up once a week, never a problem... keeps playing.
amazing.
not sure how it does it, but ive done it several times w/o a problem
im backing up my entire music drive right now
i see..,
what version of quickbooks do you use?
not sure
i just gave this guy an ubuntu7.04 cd because his windows is giving him shit freezing all the time
doesn't look like it works w/ wine
just doing some light googling, his best option might be to run WinXP in VMWare, and then install Quickboks there, and fire up Vmware when he needs to run Quickbook
doesn't look like it works under linux, and i can't find any real alternatives
yea i was thinking the same.

or, leave Windows about 10-20gig partition, which is plenty for Quickbooks, IE, and Office(which quickbooks really needs), and then assign the rest of the hard drive to Ubuntu.., and dual boot xp and ubuntu.., and just boot XP when quickbooks is needed, but vmware is probably more practical.
thanks
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=183209
i'm pretty sure its in the repositories.
lol, well true, but sucking at Linux is near te top of the list
